words_with_descriptions.dive: The act of jumping into water head-first, also a technique in football to simulate being fouled.
words_with_descriptions.dribble: The act of moving a ball by repeatedly tapping it with the hand or foot.
words_with_descriptions.grip: The way in which a player holds a sports equipment, such as a racket, bat, or club.
words_with_descriptions.pole: Refers to pole vaulting, a track and field event where a participant uses a long, flexible pole as an aid to jump over a high bar.
words_with_descriptions.jockey: A person who rides horses in races, typically as a profession.
words_with_descriptions.dodge: A fast movement to avoid a hit or throw, often used in dodgeball.
words_with_descriptions.spike: A volleyball term for a forceful hit of the ball from above the height of the net, intended to score.
words_with_descriptions.relay: A race in which several team members take turns running parts of a circuit or performing a certain action.
words_with_descriptions.chip: A short, lofted shot in golf, where the ball pops quickly into the air.
